maml:description.maml:para: The Get-AzureRmContainerGroup cmdlet gets a specified container group or all the container groups in a resource group or the subscription.

maml:Description.maml:para: The resource Group Name.
The container group Name.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The resource Group Name.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The resource id.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The container group Name.
The resource Group Name.
The resource id.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Gets a specified container group
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzureRmContainerGroup -ResourceGroupName demo -Name mycontainer
ResourceGroupName : demo Id : /subscriptions/ae43b1e3-c35d-4c8c-bc0d-f148b4c52b78/resourceGroups/demo/providers/Microsoft.ContainerInstance/containerGroups/mycontainer Name : mycontainer Type : Microsoft.ContainerInstance/containerGroups Location : westus Tags : ProvisioningState : Succeeded Containers : {mycontainer} ImageRegistryCredentials : RestartPolicy : IpAddress : 13.88.10.240 Ports : {8000} OsType : Linux Volumes : State : Running Events : {}

dev:remarks.maml:para: The command gets the specified container group.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Gets container groups in a resource group
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzureRmContainerGroup -ResourceGroupName demo
ResourceGroupName Name Location OsType Image IP Resources ProvisioningState ----------------- ---- -------- ------ ----- -- --------- ----------------- demo container1 west us Linux alpine:latest 40.83.144.50:8002 1 cores/1 gb Succeeded demo container2 west us Linux alpine:latest 104.42.228.253:8001 1 cores/1 gb Succeeded

dev:remarks.maml:para: The command gets the container groups in the resource group `demo`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Gets container groups in the current subscription
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzureRmContainerGroup
ResourceGroupName Name Location OsType Image IP Resources ProvisioningState ----------------- ---- -------- ------ ----- -- --------- ----------------- demo1 container1 west us Linux alpine:latest 40.83.144.50:8002 1 cores/1 gb Succeeded demo2 container2 west us Linux alpine:latest 104.42.228.253:8001 1 cores/1 gb Succeeded

dev:remarks.maml:para: The command gets the container groups in the current subscription.

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Gets container groups using resource Id.
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Find-AzureRmResource -ResourceGroupEquals demo -ResourceNameEquals mycontainer | Get-AzureRmContainerGroup
ResourceGroupName : demo Id : /subscriptions/ae43b1e3-c35d-4c8c-bc0d-f148b4c52b78/resourceGroups/demo/providers/Microsoft.ContainerInstance/containerGroups/mycontainer Name : mycontainer Type : Microsoft.ContainerInstance/containerGroups Location : westus Tags : ProvisioningState : Succeeded Containers : {mycontainer} ImageRegistryCredentials : RestartPolicy : IpAddress : 13.88.10.240 Ports : {8000} OsType : Linux Volumes : State : Running Events : {}

dev:remarks.maml:para: The command gets the container group with the resource Id.

maml:description.maml:para: Get the logs of a container instance in a container group.
The Get-AzureRmContainerInstanceLog cmdlet gets the logs of a container in a container group.

maml:Description.maml:para: The resource group name.
The container group name.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The container instance name in the container group. Default: the same as the container group name
The number of lines to tail the log. If not specify, the cmdlet will return up to 4MB tailed log
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The input container group object.
The container instance name in the container group. Default: the same as the container group name
The number of lines to tail the log. If not specify, the cmdlet will return up to 4MB tailed log
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The container instance name in the container group. Default: the same as the container group name
The resource id.
The number of lines to tail the log. If not specify, the cmdlet will return up to 4MB tailed log
The container group name.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The input container group object.
The container instance name in the container group. Default: the same as the container group name
The resource group name.
The resource id.
The number of lines to tail the log. If not specify, the cmdlet will return up to 4MB tailed log

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get the tail log of a container instance
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzureRmContainerInstanceLog -ResourceGroupName demo -ContainerGroupName mycontainer -Name container1
Log line 1. Log line 2. Log line 3. Log line 4.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the log from `container1` in container group `mycontainer`. By default, it will return up to 4MB log content.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Get the tail log of a container instance that has the same name as the container group
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzureRmContainerInstanceLog -ResourceGroupName demo -ContainerGroupName mycontainer
Log line 1. Log line 2. Log line 3. Log line 4.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the log from `mycontainer` in container group `mycontainer`. By default, it will return up to 4MB log content.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Get the tail 2 lines of log of a container instance
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzureRmContainerInstanceLog -ResourceGroupName demo -ContainerGroupName mycontainer -Name container1 -Tail 2
Log line 3. Log line 4.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the tail 2 lines of log from `container1` in container group `mycontainer`.

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Get the tail log of a container instance in a piped in container group
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzureRmContainerGroup -ResourceGroupName demo -Name mycontainer | Get-AzureRmContainerInstanceLog
Log line 1. Log line 2. Log line 3. Log line 4.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the log from `mycontainer` in piped in container group `mycontainer`. By default, it will return up to 4MB log content.

maml:description.maml:para: The New-AzureRmContainerGroup cmdlets creates a container group.

maml:Description.maml:para: The resource group name.
The container group name.
The container image.
The storage account credential of the Azure File share to mount where the username is the storage account name and the key is the storage account key.
The mount path for the Azure File volume.
The name of the Azure File share to mount.
The command to run in the container.
The required CPU cores. Default: 1
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The container environment variables.
The IP address type.
The container group Location. Default to the location of the resource group.
The required memory in GB. Default: 1.5
The container OS type. Default: Linux
The port(s) to open. Default: [80]
The container restart policy. Default: Always
{{Fill Tag Description}}
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The resource group name.
The container group name.
The container image.
The command to run in the container.
The required CPU cores. Default: 1
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The container environment variables.
The IP address type.
The container group Location. Default to the location of the resource group.
The required memory in GB. Default: 1.5
The container OS type. Default: Linux
The port(s) to open. Default: [80]
The custom container registry credential.
The custom container registry login server.
The container restart policy. Default: Always
{{Fill Tag Description}}
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The storage account credential of the Azure File share to mount where the username is the storage account name and the key is the storage account key.
The mount path for the Azure File volume.
The name of the Azure File share to mount.
The command to run in the container.
The required CPU cores. Default: 1
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The container environment variables.
The container image.
The IP address type.
The container group Location. Default to the location of the resource group.
The required memory in GB. Default: 1.5
The container group name.
The container OS type. Default: Linux
The port(s) to open. Default: [80]
The custom container registry credential.
The custom container registry login server.
The resource group name.
The container restart policy. Default: Always
{{Fill Tag Description}}
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-AzureRmContainerGroup -ResourceGroupName demo -Name mycontainer -Image nginx -OsType Linux -IpAddressType Public -Ports @(8000)
ResourceGroupName : demo Id : /subscriptions/ae43b1e3-c35d-4c8c-bc0d-f148b4c52b78/resourceGroups/demo/providers/Microsoft.ContainerInstance/containerGroups/mycontainer Name : mycontainer Type : Microsoft.ContainerInstance/containerGroups Location : westus Tags : ProvisioningState : Creating Containers : {mycontainer} ImageRegistryCredentials : RestartPolicy : IpAddress : 13.88.10.240 Ports : {8000} OsType : Linux Volumes : State : Running Events : {}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This commands creates a container group using latest nginx image and requests a public IP address with opening port 8000.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-AzureRmContainerGroup -ResourceGroupName demo -Name mycontainer -Image alpine -OsType Linux -Command "/bin/sh -c myscript.sh" -EnvironmentVariable @{"env1"="value1";"env2"="value2"}
ResourceGroupName : demo Id : /subscriptions/ae43b1e3-c35d-4c8c-bc0d-f148b4c52b78/resourceGroups/demo/providers/Microsoft.ContainerInstance/containerGroups/mycontainer Name : mycontainer Type : Microsoft.ContainerInstance/containerGroups Location : westus Tags : ProvisioningState : Creating Containers : {mycontainer} ImageRegistryCredentials : RestartPolicy : IpAddress : Ports : OsType : Linux Volumes : State : Running Events : {}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This commands creates a container group and runs a custom script inside the container.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Creates a run-to-completion container group.
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-AzureRmContainerGroup -ResourceGroupName demo -Name mycontainer -Image alpine -OsType Linux -Command "echo hello" -RestartPolicy Never
ResourceGroupName : demo Id : /subscriptions/ae43b1e3-c35d-4c8c-bc0d-f148b4c52b78/resourceGroups/demo/providers/Microsoft.ContainerInstance/containerGroups/mycontainer Name : mycontainer Type : Microsoft.ContainerInstance/containerGroups Location : westus Tags : ProvisioningState : Creating Containers : {mycontainer} ImageRegistryCredentials : RestartPolicy : IpAddress : Ports : OsType : Linux Volumes : State : Running Events : {}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This commands creates a container group which prints out 'hello' and stops.

command:example.maml:title: Example 4: Creates a container group using image in Azure Container Registry
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $secpasswd = ConvertTo-SecureString "PlainTextPassword" -AsPlainText -Force PS C:\> $mycred = New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential ("myacr", $secpasswd) PS C:\> New-AzureRmContainerGroup -ResourceGroupName demo -Name mycontainer -Image myacr.azurecr.io/nginx:latest -IpAddressType Public -RegistryCredential $mycred
ResourceGroupName : demo Id : /subscriptions/ae43b1e3-c35d-4c8c-bc0d-f148b4c52b78/resourceGroups/demo/providers/Microsoft.ContainerInstance/containerGroups/mycontainer Name : mycontainer Type : Microsoft.ContainerInstance/containerGroups Location : westus Tags : ProvisioningState : Creating Containers : {mycontainer} ImageRegistryCredentials : {myacr} RestartPolicy : IpAddress : 13.88.10.240 Ports : {80} OsType : Linux Volumes : State : Running Events : {}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This commands creates a container group using a nginx image in Azure Container Registry.

command:example.maml:title: Example 5: Creates a container group using image in custom container image registry
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $secpasswd = ConvertTo-SecureString "PlainTextPassword" -AsPlainText -Force PS C:\> $mycred = New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential ("username", $secpasswd) PS C:\> New-AzureRmContainerGroup -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroup -Name MyContainer -Image myserver.com/myimage:latest -RegistryServer myserver.com -RegistryCredential $mycred
ResourceGroupName : demo Id : /subscriptions/ae43b1e3-c35d-4c8c-bc0d-f148b4c52b78/resourceGroups/demo/providers/Microsoft.ContainerInstance/containerGroups/mycontainer Name : mycontainer Type : Microsoft.ContainerInstance/containerGroups Location : westus Tags : ProvisioningState : Creating Containers : {mycontainer} ImageRegistryCredentials : {myserver.com} RestartPolicy : IpAddress : 13.88.10.240 Ports : {80} OsType : Linux Volumes : State : Running Events : {}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This commands creates a container group using a custom image from a custom container image registry.

command:example.maml:title: Example 6: Creates a container group that mounts Azure File volume
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $secpasswd = ConvertTo-SecureString "PlainTextPassword" -AsPlainText -Force PS C:\> $mycred = New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential ("username", $secpasswd) PS C:\> New-AzureRmContainerGroup -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroup -Name MyContainer -Image alpine -AzureFileVolumeShareName myshare -AzureFileVolumeAccountKey $mycred -AzureFileVolumeMountPath /mnt/azfile
ResourceGroupName : demo Id : /subscriptions/ae43b1e3-c35d-4c8c-bc0d-f148b4c52b78/resourceGroups/demo/providers/Microsoft.ContainerInstance/containerGroups/mycontainer Name : mycontainer Type : Microsoft.ContainerInstance/containerGroups Location : westus Tags : ProvisioningState : Creating Containers : {mycontainer} ImageRegistryCredentials : {myserver.com} RestartPolicy : IpAddress : 13.88.10.240 Ports : {80} OsType : Linux Volumes : {AzureFile} State : Running Events : {}

dev:remarks.maml:para: This commands creates a container group that mounts the provided Azure File share to `/mnt/azfile`.

maml:description.maml:para: The Remove-AzureRmContainerGroup cmdlet removes a container group.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The container group to remove.
{{Fill PassThru Description}}
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The resource group name.
The container group name.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
{{Fill PassThru Description}}
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
{{Fill PassThru Description}}
The resource id.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The container group to remove.
The container group name.
{{Fill PassThru Description}}
The resource group name.
The resource id.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the specified container group.

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Removes a container group by piping
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureRmContainerGroup -ResourceGroupName MyResourceGroup -Name MyContainer | Remove-AzureRmContainerGroup

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes a container group by piping.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3: Removes a container group by resource Id.
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Find-AzureRmResource -ResourceGroupEquals MyResourceGroup -ResourceNameEquals MyContainer | Remove-AzureRmContainerGroup

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes a container group by resource Id.
